_header: Half in dead sleep not fully revived
Title(s): ‘A balade on the House of Vere’
Subjects: history, family; Vere, family of; envoys
_description: Rotheley, ‘A balade on the House of Vere’ — fifteen stanzas rhyme royal, one concluding 8-line stanza and Envoy in one stanza rhyme royal

HunEL26C9.First Lines:
Halfe in a dede sclepe not fully revyvedRudely my sylfe as I lay
                    alone…
HunEL26C9.Last Lines:
…Thy makere standyng in dyssete and greuaunceWhich cawsed hym
                    the so symply to avaunce…
HunEL26C9.Note:
Wrongly listed as in EL 26.C.3 in Brown  and  Robbins (1943)
XCarleton Fairchild Brown,   and  Rossell Hope Robbins.  
             The Index of Middle English Verse.
         New York: Printed for the Index Society by Columbia University Press,
            1943; 192 lines
                    RR.
